conversation.content: I’m attending a 3-day conference. Help me choose sessions without schedule conflicts and align with my goals.

content.text: Great—let’s build a conflict-free, goal-aligned plan. Use the agenda below to browse each day, filter by topics or speakers, and tap the star to favorite sessions. Conflicts are highlighted when two favorites overlap so you can resolve them quickly. Then, set your goals so I can fine-tune recommendations and filters for you. If you share your topic priorities, preferred speakers, and any times to avoid, I’ll narrow the options and suggest a balanced pace across the 3 days.

sessions.title: Opening Keynote: The Next Decade of Tech
sessions.summary: Kick off with trends shaping software, AI, and developer productivity.

sessions.title: AI Systems in Production: Patterns and Pitfalls
sessions.summary: Operationalizing AI with observability, evaluation, and safety.

sessions.title: Modern Frontend Architectures (React, Signals, Islands)
sessions.summary: Compare emerging patterns for performance and team scaling.

sessions.title: TypeScript at Scale: Contracts, DX, and Tooling
Generative AI Security: Prompt Injection to Model Theft
Morning Keynote: Building with Responsible AI
RAG in Practice: Evaluation, Caching, and Cost Control
Performance Budgets for Modern Web Apps
Incident Response: From Alert to Postmortem

props.name: Your Profile
props.title: Set Your Conference Goals
props.description: Tell us what matters so we can filter sessions, avoid conflicts, and pace your days.

quality_criteria: Should interpret the user's request as creating a conflict-free, goal-aligned plan across all 3 conference days
Should present a multi-track agenda view that clearly lists sessions by day, with times, rooms, tracks, topics, and speakers
Should enable marking sessions as favorites and highlight schedule conflicts when favorite sessions overlap in time
Should provide clear instructions for resolving conflicts (e.g., un-favoriting one of the overlapping sessions or suggesting alternatives)
Should include filters by topic and speaker to narrow the agenda based on user preferences
Should solicit and capture user goals/preferences (priority topics, preferred speakers, times to avoid, session pace) and use them to tailor recommendations
Should produce or enable a personalized agenda summary that avoids conflicts, respects avoidTimes, and aligns with the stated goals and session pace
Should accurately reflect session dates and times, using the specified time zone consistently across the agenda
Should avoid suggesting sessions that fall within the user's avoidTimes unless explicitly overridden by the user
Should ensure data consistency across sessions, tracks, topics, and speakers (IDs and names should match across filters, favorites, and goals)
Should not fabricate or hallucinate sessions; all sessions shown should be within the provided 3-day conference window
Should provide actionable guidance for the next steps (e.g., star favorites, set or adjust goals) to finalize the agenda
Should use UI components appropriate for the scenario that match user expectations for browsing, filtering, favoriting, conflict highlighting, and goal setting
Should pass appropriate and valid props to the UI components (e.g., days, sessions, tracks, favoriteSessionIds, filters, timeZone, onUserEventAction, goals payload)
Should only call external tools if additional data fetching or computation is required; if tools are called, arguments must be correct and relevant
Should keep the response concise, clear, and free of unrelated content while covering agenda browsing, conflict handling, goal capture, and personalized planning

conversation.content: Goals: deepen AI ethics and practical GenAI, learn scalable microservices/DevOps patterns, and meet healthcare startup founders. Priorities: AI/ML, architecture, DevOps; preferred speakers: Dr. Kim Lee, Priya Shah; avoid sessions before 9:30am and overlapping keynotes; prefer 45‑min talks over long workshops and leave a 30‑min buffer for expo/networking—please suggest a conflict‑free 3‑day plan and apply filters.

content.text:
Awesome—I've applied your goals and built a conflict‑free, 3‑day plan with 45‑minute talks, 30‑minute buffers, and no sessions before 9:30am. I also prioritized AI ethics/GenAI, scalable microservices/DevOps, and time with healthcare startup founders, and highlighted sessions by Dr. Kim Lee and Priya Shah. You can tweak filters or unfavorite anything and I’ll keep it conflict‑free.

What I set for you:
- Filters: Topics = AI/ML, GenAI, Ethics, Architecture, DevOps, Healthcare; Speakers = Dr. Kim Lee, Priya Shah
- Schedule rules: start at/after 9:30am, prefer 45‑min talks, 30‑min buffer between sessions, avoid overlapping keynotes

Tip: Tap any session to open details; star to favorite/unfavorite. If you adjust, conflicts (if any) will be flagged so you can resolve quickly.

sessions.title: Keynote: Responsible GenAI at Scale
sessions.summary: How to deploy GenAI systems responsibly with governance and safety guardrails.

sessions.title: AI Safety in Healthcare Workflows
sessions.summary: Bias, safety, and validation practices for AI in clinical workflows.

sessions.title: Microservices Reliability Patterns
sessions.summary: Idempotency, retries, backpressure, and circuit breaking at scale.

sessions.title: DevOps for Regulated Industries
sessions.summary: Pipelines, auditability, and change control for HIPAA/FDA contexts.

sessions.title: Founder Meetup: Healthcare Startups
sessions.summary: Meet early‑stage health tech founders working with AI.

sessions.title: Hands‑On: LLM Fine‑Tuning (2h workshop)
sessions.summary: Long workshop alternative (not selected; you prefer 45‑min talks).

sessions.title: Keynote: The State of AI in Production
sessions.summary: Practical lessons from scaling AI systems in the wild.

sessions.title: Practical Prompt Engineering for Clinicians
sessions.summary: Clinician‑friendly patterns that improve reliability and safety.

sessions.title: Event‑Driven Microservices at Scale
sessions.summary: Designing resilient, evolvable, and observable event backbones.

sessions.title: Platform Engineering for Startups
sessions.summary: Golden paths, self‑service, and lowering cognitive load.

sessions.title: Founder Pitches: Health Tech
sessions.summary: Meet founders and see demos aligned to AI in healthcare.

sessions.title: Full‑Day Workshop: GitOps Deep Dive
sessions.summary: Long workshop alternative (not selected; you prefer 45‑min talks).

sessions.title: Keynote: Building Trustworthy Systems
sessions.summary: Architectural principles for safety, robustness, and accountability.

sessions.title: Evaluating GenAI Models Responsibly
sessions.summary: Metrics, red‑teaming, and alignment for real‑world deployments.

sessions.title: Observability Patterns for Microservices
sessions.summary: From traces to SLOs—operational excellence at scale.

sessions.title: Fireside: Scaling a Healthcare Startup
sessions.summary: Go‑to‑market, compliance, and tech choices with founders.

sessions.title: Closing Panel: Future of GenAI in Healthcare
sessions.summary: Ethics, efficacy, and entrepreneurship—what’s next?

sessions.title: Service Mesh: When and Why
sessions.summary: Alternative in the same slot (not selected to avoid conflicts).

selectedSessions.title: Keynote: The State of AI in Production
Closing Panel: Future of GenAI in Healthcare

quality_criteria: Should present a clear, conflict-free 3-day agenda aligned to the user's goals and constraints
Should apply and display filters for prioritized topics (AI/ML, GenAI, Ethics, Architecture, DevOps, Healthcare) and preferred speakers (Dr. Kim Lee, Priya Shah)
Should ensure no sessions start before 9:30am, avoid overlapping keynotes, prefer 45-minute talks over long workshops, and include 30-minute buffers between selected sessions
Should prioritize AI ethics/GenAI, scalable microservices/DevOps, and sessions enabling interaction with healthcare startup founders
Should explicitly indicate any longer workshops as alternatives and ensure they are not selected given the user's preferences
Should provide a per-day schedule with times, titles, tracks, and speakers, ensuring internal consistency of times, durations, and buffers in the specified time zone
Should include a summary of selected sessions, totals per day, favorite count, and zero conflicts in a concise agenda summary
Should use appropriate UI components to display a multi-track agenda view with favorites and conflicts highlighting, topic/speaker filters, and a personalized agenda summary
Should include actionable controls for user adjustments (e.g., favoriting/unfavoriting, filters) and an option to export the agenda
Should present accurate, relevant, and non-contradictory information with consistent identifiers for sessions, tracks, topics, and speakers
Should avoid unnecessary heavy formatting and provide concise, user-oriented guidance consistent with the scenario context
Should not call external tools unless data fetching or computation beyond the provided scenario is required

conversation.content: Please show the day-by-day agenda (times, titles, speakers, rooms), with Dr. Kim Lee and Priya Shah sessions highlighted and my 30‑min networking buffers marked. If “AI Ethics in Healthcare” or “GenAI Case Studies for Clinicians” fit my rules, add them; otherwise suggest the closest alternatives. Also export the finalized plan to my Google Calendar.

content.text:
Here’s your conflict‑free, 3‑day agenda with 45‑minute talks, 30‑minute networking buffers, no sessions before 9:30am, and no overlapping keynotes. I highlighted sessions featuring Dr. Kim Lee and Priya Shah, and included both “AI Ethics in Healthcare” and “GenAI Case Studies for Clinicians” (both fit your rules). Buffers are shown as “Networking Buffer” blocks. To export to Google Calendar, use the Export Agenda action (Calendar) in the summary.

Notes:
- Priorities applied: AI/ML, GenAI, Ethics, Architecture, DevOps, Healthcare founders.
- Speakers highlighted: Dr. Kim Lee, Priya Shah.
- 30‑minute networking buffers inserted between all sessions.
- No conflicts detected.

If you want me to adjust pace or swap any slot (e.g., more founder meetups), tell me which day/slot and I’ll re‑optimize.

quality_criteria: Should present a clear, day-by-day agenda listing for all three days, including start/end times, session titles, speaker names, and rooms
Should explicitly highlight sessions featuring Dr. Kim Lee and Priya Shah in both the narrative and UI component data
Should insert and clearly mark 30‑minute networking buffers between sessions, labeled appropriately and precisely 30 minutes in duration
Should include “AI Ethics in Healthcare” and “GenAI Case Studies for Clinicians” if they meet the user's constraints; otherwise, should suggest the closest alternatives with a brief justification
Should ensure all schedule constraints are satisfied: no sessions before 9:30am, 45‑minute talk durations, no overlapping keynotes, and no session conflicts
Should verify internal consistency of times and durations, and represent all times in the stated timezone (America/New_York)
Should provide a multi-track agenda view that aligns with the scenario (favorites and conflicts highlighting, topic/speaker filters, personalized agenda summary)
Should include filters for the requested topics and speakers, and indicate favorites/conflicts as configured
Should supply a personalized agenda summary with selected sessions, per‑day counts, total favorite count, and conflict count
Should expose an actionable export mechanism to Google Calendar (e.g., an export action with format 'calendar' or equivalent), using appropriate tool or component action

Should use the specified UI components with complete and correct props: agenda planner includes days, sessions with metadata, tracks, filters, favorites, timezone, and summary flag; summary includes selectedSessions, totals, timezone config, and a primary export action

Should avoid introducing unsupported external actions; if direct calendar export is not possible, should provide a clear fallback (e.g., downloadable calendar file or instructions) while still offering an actionable path
Should maintain a conflict-free schedule across tracks and ensure no overlapping keynotes or double-booked highlighted speakers
Should keep the narrative concise, actionable, and aligned to the user's goals, offering to adjust pace or swap slots upon request

conversation.content: Looks great—please swap the Day 2 3:00pm DevOps talk for a founders meet‑and‑greet in the Startup Pavilion and keep the 30‑min buffer. If Priya Shah has Day 1 afternoon availability, book a 20‑min coffee chat; then export the updated plan to my Google Calendar with 10‑minute reminders.

content.text:
Done—I've swapped your Day 2 3:00pm DevOps talk for a Founders Meet‑and‑Greet in the Startup Pavilion and kept a 30‑minute buffer. I also placed a 20‑minute Day 1 afternoon coffee chat with Priya Shah as a Hold; if her availability shifts, tell me your preferred window and I’ll re-slot it without conflicts. Use the Export Agenda action to push this plan to your Google Calendar; I’ll include 10‑minute reminders on each item during export.

Highlights
- Dr. Kim Lee and Priya Shah sessions are marked (⭐) in the agenda.
- “AI Ethics in Healthcare” and “GenAI Case Studies for Clinicians” are included and meet your rules.
- All sessions start at/after 9:30am, are 45 minutes where possible, and include a 30‑minute networking buffer between items.

If you want me to replace any slot with more founder time or hallway chats, just say which day and time and I’ll re-optimize.

quality_criteria: Should explicitly implement the requested swap: replace the Day 2 (2025-05-03) 3:00pm DevOps session with a Founders Meet-and-Greet in the Startup Pavilion, preserving a 30-minute buffer adjacent to that slot

Should handle the conditional booking: add a 20-minute Day 1 afternoon coffee chat with Priya Shah if she has availability; if availability is pending, mark it as a Hold and indicate how it will be re-slotted without conflicts upon confirmation
Should ensure no scheduling conflicts across all days after updates, maintaining buffers and honoring session durations and start times
Should keep global constraints: sessions start at or after 9:30am, use 45-minute sessions where feasible, and maintain 30-minute networking buffers between items
Should update all displayed data consistently: the agenda view and the summary must reflect identical sessions, times, durations, rooms, and speakers
Should maintain accurate time zone handling (America/New_York) with correct ISO 8601 timestamps and durations
Should preserve and clearly indicate favorites/highlights for specified speakers (e.g., Dr. Kim Lee, Priya Shah) and important sessions as per the user’s goals

Should provide a clear export action to Google Calendar and specify 10-minute reminders on each exported item; if external actions are required, should call or surface the appropriate tool/action with correct parameters
Should include accurate totals per day, favorite counts, and conflict counts, and show conflict badges if configured
Should keep filtering options by topic and speaker consistent with the user’s interests and ensure they apply to the displayed sessions
Should use concise natural language confirmation summarizing the changes and offering next-step options (e.g., adjusting windows for the coffee chat)
Should avoid introducing unsupported or hallucinated sessions, speakers, tracks, or actions, and keep IDs, track names, and speaker references consistent across components
